zone.line: the chamber, the shutters had been thrown back; and,
with a sensation of horror not be described, ^ I saw that
the open window a figure the most hidious and
abhorred. A grin was was on the face of the monster;
he seemed to jeer as with his fiendish finger he pointed
towards the window corpse of my wife. I rushed towards
the window, and, drawing a pistol from the window and
my bosom, shot; but he eluded me, leapt from his
station, and running with the swiftness of lightning
plunged into the lake. [XThe report of the pistol brought
a crowd into the room; I pointed to where he had
disappeared and we followed the tract with boats; nets
were cast but in vain. After passing in the several
hours we returned hopeless, most of my companions
